intro: Boerhavia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-stamen bluestem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Boerhavia tetrandra has slender, erect stems and small, narrow leaves. It is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
